meanings.definition: To reverse the process of doubling.
meanings.sent1: She had to undouble the amount of sugar in the recipe.
meanings.sent2: He quickly undoubled the number of chairs in the room.
meanings.sent3: Trying to undouble the knots in the tangled yarn was like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to undouble the length of the scarf with a swift motion.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to undouble the clues to solve the case.

meanings.definition: To make single or not double.
meanings.sent1: They decided to undouble the portions to avoid waste.
meanings.sent2: The tailor had to undouble the fabric to fit the design.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to undouble the ingredients to create a new dish.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to undouble the joy in everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The repairman had to undouble the wires to fix the connection.

meanings.definition: To undo the act of doubling.
meanings.sent1: He needed to undouble the copies he accidentally made.
meanings.sent2: The gardener had to undouble the planting to give each flower space.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke managed to undouble the tension in the room.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to undouble the colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to undouble the assignments to give the students more time.
